page.title: 02HOUSING IN CHIRNSIDE
page.content: The population of Chirnside is about 1100. Most of the older houses were built on either side of the Main Street and down the Crosshill. There is a mixture of privately owned and council properties. In the south of the village, a large new council scheme was built from 1971 onwards. This provided housing for an influx of workers who were employed by the local paper mill which had been re-opened that year. The rent for a 4-apartment council house is Â£25 per week. A private estate of 19 detached houses has been built at the east end of the village, beginning in 1973. Several other private houses have been built throughout the village. The Loaning,a development of sheltered housing, built by Kirk Care Housing Association and Berwickshire District Council, was opened in 1984.
